overview:
Matthijs is an entrepreneur who gained significant experience in managing operational, BD/marketing and financial activities in two biotechnology start-ups in Cambridge (UK), Malaysia and Singapore. As a co-founder and COO in SimuGen he was responsible for raising VC funding, building a team, setting up a global supply chain, and securing key customers/partners. Currently, he’s involved as an entrepreneur in residence and COO in Camtech, a Singapore/Cambridge based technology incubator.

In addition to his international entrepreneurial activities, Matthijs has been very active as a consultant at the Cambridge-MIT Institute and Library House in Cambridge (UK). He also worked as a Biosciences Analyst at Imperial Innovations in London where he performed due diligence and market analysis of spin-out, licensing and investment opportunities arising from Imperial College and external Universities/Research Institutes.

Matthijs is trained at world class Universities in Europe such as the University of Cambridge and the University of Utrecht, where he gained a BsC in Biomedical Sciences and a MsC in Science & Business. He has also been involved in a number of entrepreneurship and innovation programmes, such as the Cambridge University Entrepreneurs and the MIT Global Start-up Workshop.
